Not all of my samples need to be processed together. This script will make the appropriate subset files. First, read in the new data

```{r readdata}
countbygene.csv <- read.csv("../data/rnaseq/countbygene.csv", header=T, check.names = F)
kallistosamples.csv <- read.csv("../data/rnaseq/kallistosamples.csv", header=T)
rownames(colData) <- colData$RNAseqID
```

## Subset for dissociation test

```{r subset for dissociation test}
dissociationsamples <- kallistosamples %>%
  filter(Group %in% c("homecage", "control")) %>%
  filter(Conflict != "NoConflict")
savecols <- as.character(dissociationsamples$RNAseqID) #selects all good samples
savecols <- as.vector(savecols) # make it a vector
dissociationcountbygene <- countbygene %>% select(one_of(savecols)) # keep good samples
```
